Package main

Class RandomPoint

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.Point2D
java.awt.Point
main.RandomPoint
All Implemented Interfaces:
CollisionElement, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class RandomPoint
extends java.awt.Point
implements CollisionElement
The RandomPoint is used to find a set of co-ordinates that is not colliding with any other entities or the game boundary.
See Also:
Serialized Form

    RandomPoint​(Pickup pickup)

    Test if the collision box provided is colliding with the random point.
    void selectPoint()
    Selects a random and free point for use by the Pickup by querying the CollisionController and the pickup to ensure it's outside of the deadzone, and not in the way of any other entities

  • Constructor Details

    • RandomPoint

      public RandomPoint​(Pickup pickup)
      Construct the new random point, and set the width and height to that of the Pickup instance provided
      Parameters:
      pickup - The pickup instance used to test for free co-ordinates

  • Method Details

    • selectPoint

      public void selectPoint()
      Selects a random and free point for use by the Pickup by querying the CollisionController and the pickup to ensure it's outside of the deadzone, and not in the way of any other entities

    • collidedWithGameBoundary

      public boolean collidedWithGameBoundary​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox)
      Notifies this point that we've collided with the game boundary. Consume the collision event so that the EntityController will return true during our collision testing
      Specified by:
      collidedWithGameBoundary in interface CollisionElement
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box intersecting the boundary
      Returns:
      Return true to consume the collision
      See Also:
      selectPoint()

    • collidedWithBy

      public boolean collidedWithBy​(java.awt.Rectangle collisionBox, CollisionElement source, java.awt.Rectangle infringedBoundary)
      Notifies us that we've been collided with. We're not interested in that so the collision is ignored
      Specified by:
      collidedWithBy in interface CollisionElement
      Parameters:
      collisionBox - The collision box
      source - The source of the collision
      infringedBoundary - The boundary infringed by the collision
      Returns:
      Returns false to allow the collision to continue to propagate

    • isCollisionBoxIntersecting

      public java.awt.Rectangle isCollisionBoxIntersecting​(java.awt.Rectangle collision, CollisionElement source)
      Test if the collision box provided is colliding with the random point. This entity doesn't exist in the game, and cannot be collided with by other entities
      Specified by:
      isCollisionBoxIntersecting in interface CollisionElement
      Parameters:
      collision - The collision box to test against
      source - The source of the collision box
      Returns:
      Returns null to indicate no boundary has been infringed by this collision

    • getBounds

      public java.awt.Rectangle getBounds()
      Calculates the boundary of the RandomPoint
      Specified by:
      getBounds in interface CollisionElement
      Returns:
      Returns the boundary
